name: AutoGeeniMotionDetection
description: - Both of these are required and can be downloaded [here](https://github.com/nodesource/distributions).     - If using a Raspberry Pi Zero W, follow [these](https://www.thepolyglotdeveloper.com/2018/03/install-nodejs-raspberry-pi-zero-w-nodesource/) instructions instead. ### Geeni - Geeni is connected to the Google Assistant. - The cameras are named the same as in `program.js`.     - This can be done through the Google Home app or the Geeni app. ### Google Assistant Server - [REST-GoogleAssistant]() must be set up and operational.     - Take note of the port that the server is listening on and make sure that the port is forwarded. ## Installation - Everything in the __Prerequisites__ section must be done first! - After cloning:     - Run `npm install` to install packages.     - Run `node program.js` to start. - Optionally, add the following line to `/etc/rc.local` for auto startup:     - `sudo node "/PATH/TO/REPO/program.js"`.
